resources.string: a highly recommended minimal white icon pack designed by Tom Ver (Randle) - an exquisite accompaniment to this theme.
"Dark Material - CM12/CM12.1/13 Theme UI (From the App)"
"Dark Material - COS12/COS12.1 Theme UI (From the App)"
"Dark Material - Layers Theme UI (From the App)"

dark material is cm12/cm12.1/cm13's first and original dark theme, with monthly design updates and bug fixes - installed by more than 400,000 users with over 75,000 active users on play! having over 145 original app overlays, this is the most complete theme available on the play store!

now available for both cmte and layers (beta) for lollipop and marshmallow devices!
"if you haven't already, please check out our other themes and boot animations on Play!"
"if you like what we're doing, and appreciate our thousands of hours spent on this theme and app, please consider donating to us!"
"for more information about the theme and the development of the theme/app/installer, check out the official forum thread."
"to join our exclusive beta access community and have quick communication between the devs, please join our community!"
After applying/updating the theme (after one minute), REBOOT YOUR PHONE TWICE.
Please be sure you apply a dark themed framework with a dark themed SystemUI overlay, or else you will get unreadable texts!
Traditional Theme Engine not found. Rerouting to Settings for other options.
"You are not downloading our theme from the Google Play Store. You have two options only:"
"Thank you for purchasing our awesome icon pack. If you like this icon pack, don't forget to Rate and Write a review at Google Play Store."

to understand why this theme doesn't follow google's traditional "material dark" design with dark teal and/or blue grey, i will briefly explain. 

this theme wasn't based on google's material style, but was mainly influenced by the "tinted status bar" mod's results, where it completely made the action bar into one fused item. i really liked this design, which made the system more minimal as it had two layers to look at, rather than 3 (action bar primary, action bar primary dark (status bar darkened color) and the fragment layer (the interacting area)). 

the fact that i named this theme "dark material" over "material dark" was because i wanted to depict a dark, physical metamorphic rock - "slate", and it's color. as the color scheme of this theme is mainly dark (black, grey and white text), i added the word "dark" in front of my interpretation of "material" hence the title "dark material". themes that follow google's material dark, should show up as "material dark" to ensure consistency (see google keyboard settings for reference)

chummy development team takes a lot of consideration to our beta testers and contributors to our theme. the people listed below have tested for many hours to make dark material such a wonderful theme that we all love!

we hope to work with much more people who are willing to actively test or develop fixes for any issues that may come up during build!

thank you everyone who worked on this project with us!

"
Pneuma Anonymous (Pneuma1985)

Vivek Neel (Vivek_Neel

Kevin Dixson (Punchieo)"
"These apps are not themed. Thanks in advance.
"Would you like to crop the image, or let the app set it automatically?"
"Please check your internet connection and try again."
"Download completed, the image is stored in: \n"
"Error while downloading wallpapers info. Try again later."
"If you do not select any app for the icon request, it will be automatically generated with all your apps."
"Wallpapers are stored on Cloud Server. Please connect to Internet and try again."
"This tool installs the Dark Material boot animation onto /system/media.\n\nIf you haven't backed up your stock boot animation using the third option, please do that prior to running this tool."

"This tool restores the stock boot animation located in /emulated/0/DarkMaterial/BootAnimation to /system/media and sets the permissions accordingly.\n\nIf you want to flash a custom boot animation downloaded from a third party website, place your downloaded boot animation as "original_bootanimation.zip" in /emulated/0/DarkMaterial/BootAnimation and use this tool to flash it to your phone automagically."

"This tool backs up your current boot animation onto /emulated/0/DarkMaterial/BootAnimation as "original_bootanimation.zip". This tool should be used first before installing/restoring custom boot animations.\n\nIf you want to keep your stock boot animation using this tool, only run this once!"

"You are about to perform a SystemUI restart on your device.

This allows for SystemUI hooks to be reloaded for the theme to overlay it, however this is a temporary solution if you haven't rebooted yet.

Please make sure you don't have any unsaved work open before proceeding!"

"You are about to perform a system reboot on your device.

CMTE: Perform this twice.
Layers: Immediately reboot after applying.

Please make sure you don't have any unsaved work open before proceeding!"
we have over 153 apps overlaid in both our cm and layers version of dark material. carefully categorized below
With this app, you can monitor the errors that you may be getting (if the app gets forcibly uninstalled). Save the log and email it to me please!

chummy development team is a small group of dedicated android fanatics working together to provide a plethora of android development projects to the public. including rom ports, app development, themes and guides.
cdt lead themer & team bliss developer
cdt would like to thank @jahirfiquitiva for the original app source. \nall licenses used are viewable in the public source and apply to this app.
why does this app need root?
as android requires root for you to use certain permissions, the three buttons on the home screen include \'restart systemui\' and \'restart device\', which require root access.
why does this app have so many permissions?

the app comes with:
a wallpaper downloading section (network permissions)
after download the wallpaper can be immediately set as wallpaper (set wallpaper permission)
wallpaper/bootanimation saving on internal storage (modify/delete contents permission).

how do i use the boot animation installer in this app to set a custom bootanimation (layers)?

[Restore BootAnimation secondary feature]

all you have to do is navigate to /emulated/0/DarkMaterial/BootAnimation/ and put your bootanimation inside, named "original_bootanimation.zip" (without quotes). the installer will automatically recognize and transfer your bootanimation to /system/media/, correctly setting all permissions. this tool will need root to work.

take off the theme, go into esfileexplorer, open the drawer and press the theme button. click on default theme and adjust the theme so that everything is inverted on a black theme. re-apply dark material then you\'re done!
some aspects of the device is not themed (cmte/layers)

make sure you restarted your device twice (cm theme engine). if it remains unthemed, email me the name of your rom, attach a screenshot and tell me how to replicate this issue (if on a third party app).
there\'s an unthemed icon in settings...what should I do? (cmte/layers)
if you are on a rom with an icon that is not themed inside Settings, email me the name of your rom, and attach a screenshot.
notifications are white text on white background (cmte)"
you must apply a dark theme\'s style and status bar together. if you do not apply both you will have unreadable texts in the notification drawer.
notifications are white text on white background (layers)"
you must apply a dark theme\'s framework and systemui together. if you do not apply both you will have unreadable texts in the notification drawer.
applying the theme causes a bootloop (cmte)
please read the description on the play store and follow the several solutions there.
status bar is not theming even though i picked to theme it (cmte)
please read the description on the play store and follow the link to a youtube video, i have provided a solution there.
nav bar isn\'t theming properly, it keeps reverting back to stock! (cmte)
apply default theme\'s navigation bar, then apply dark material\'s navigation bar. this is a bug with cmte.
do you have a version of the theme without custom icons? (cmte)
there\'s a regression theme for all my cmte themes available on play store, you can check them out.
first make sure you do not have GoogleDeskClock installed, do not freeze it using tibu. you must completely remove it from the phone. if it still remains, please send me a log.
